clause.text: Implement reasonable security practices and procedures aligned with the sensitivity of data handled.

penalties.details: Compensation for negligence resulting in data breach.

clause.text: User consent must be obtained before collecting or using personal or sensitive data.

penalties.details: Violation can result in compensation claims from users.

clause.text: Disclosure of personal information without consent is prohibited except under legal obligation.

penalties.details: Imprisonment up to 3 years or fine up to â‚¹5,00,000, or both.

clause.text: Users have the right to request deletion of their personal information from the platform.

penalties.details: Non-compliance may lead to user complaints to data protection authorities.

clause.text: Users must be notified of cookies usage and allowed to opt-out.

penalties.details: Potential user complaints or loss of trust.

clause.text: Regulated Entities must verify the UNSCR 1718 Sanctions List on the MEA website daily and take note of any changes, including additions or deletions of designated individuals and entities.

penalties.details: Non-compliance may lead to enforcement action under FEMA and AML regulations.

evidence_required: Archived copies of reviewed sanction list

clause.text: NGOs must obtain FCRA registration or prior permission to accept foreign contributions.

penalties.details: Unauthorized acceptance of foreign contributions can lead to cancellation of registration and legal action.

clause.text: Entities must apply for renewal of FCRA registration at least six months before expiry.

penalties.details: Failure to renew on time may result in expiration of registration and inability to receive foreign contributions.

clause.text: Foreign contributions must be utilized strictly for the purposes for which they were received.

penalties.details: Diversion of funds can lead to cancellation of registration and legal proceedings.

clause.text: NGOs must maintain a separate bank account exclusively for the receipt and utilization of foreign contributions.

penalties.details: Non-compliance may result in penalties and scrutiny of financial transactions.

clause.text: Annual returns detailing foreign contributions received and utilized must be filed online with the MHA.

penalties.details: Failure to file returns can lead to penalties and suspension of registration.

clause.text: Organizations must apply for recognition of tax-exempt status under Section 501(c)(3) by submitting Form 1023 or Form 1023-EZ electronically via Pay.gov, including the appropriate user fee.

penalties.details: Failure to obtain recognition may result in ineligibility for tax-exempt benefits and potential tax liabilities.

clause.text: Social welfare organizations must submit Form 8976, Notice of Intent to Operate Under Section 501(c)(4), electronically via Pay.gov within 60 days of formation.

penalties.details: Late notification may result in penalties up to $20 per day, not to exceed $5,000.

clause.text: Organizations seeking tax-exempt status under Section 501(a) must file Form 1024 or Form 1024-A electronically via Pay.gov, including the appropriate user fee.

penalties.details: Failure to obtain recognition may result in ineligibility for tax-exempt benefits and potential tax liabilities.

clause.text: Organizations must notify the IRS of their intent to operate as a tax-exempt organization within 27 months of formation to have tax-exempt status retroactive to the date of formation.

penalties.details: Late notification may result in tax-exempt status effective from the date of application rather than the date of formation.

clause.text: Tax-exempt organizations must make their approved application for recognition of exemption and the last three annual information returns available for public inspection upon request.

penalties.details: Failure to comply may result in penalties of $20 per day, up to a maximum of $10,000 for each failure.

evidence_required: Copies of Form 1023/1024 and supporting documents
Copies of the last three Form 990 series returns
Records of public inspection requests and responses

clause.text: Associations must open and operate the designated 'FCRA Account' as provided under the amended Section 17(1) of the Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act, 2010.

penalties.details: Non-compliance may lead to cancellation of registration and legal action.

clause.text: Validity of FCRA registration certificates extended as per Public Notice dated 28th March 2025.

penalties.details: Operating with an expired registration may lead to penalties.

clause.text: Compounding of offences under the FCRA, 2010 as per Notification dated 1st July 2022 and subsequent amendments.

penalties.details: Offences may be compounded upon payment of specified penalties.

clause.text: Intimation to the Central Government regarding change in key members of the association under rule 9 and rule 17A of the Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Rules, 2011.

penalties.details: Failure to intimate changes may lead to penalties.

clause.text: Intimation to the Central Government regarding opening of additional FC-utilisation bank account under rule 9 and rule 17A of the Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Rules, 2011.

penalties.details: Non-intimation may lead to scrutiny and penalties.

clause.text: Intimation to the Central Government regarding change of designated bank/branch/bank account number of designated FC receipt-cum-utilisation bank account under rule 9 and rule 17A of the Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Rules, 2011.

penalties.details: Failure to intimate changes may lead to penalties.

clause.text: Intimation of receipt of foreign contribution by way of gift/as articles/securities/by candidate for election using FC-1 form.

penalties.details: Non-intimation may lead to penalties.

clause.text: HSBC failed to maintain effective anti-money laundering controls and facilitated money laundering for drug cartels, resulting in a $1.9 billion settlement.

penalties.details: HSBC agreed to pay a $1.92 billion settlement to U.S. authorities.

evidence_required: Transaction records showing money laundering activities

clause.text: NGOs must not bypass FCRA registration by routing foreign donations via commercial entities.

penalties.details: ED froze Amnesty's accounts and imposed fines for indirect foreign funding.

clause.text: NGOs must not use foreign funds in a manner considered harmful to national interests under Section 12(4)(f) of the FCRA.

penalties.details: Government blocked foreign funds for Greenpeace India, citing anti-development agenda.

clause.text: Filing of annual returns and proper utilization of foreign funds is mandatory under FCRA Rules.

penalties.details: FCRA licenses of six NGOs cancelled due to violations like late filing or misuse of funds.

clause.text: Financial institutions must maintain robust AML controls to prevent money laundering under the BSA.

penalties.details: HSBC paid $1.92 billion for AML failures involving drug cartel money.

clause.text: FCRA registration can be cancelled for NGOs violating the Act, engaging in anti-national activities, or misutilizing foreign funds.

penalties.details: More than 6,600 NGOs have had FCRA licenses cancelled for non-compliance or misuse of funds.

clause.text: NGOs must not use benami operations or unauthorized proxy accounts to receive or utilize foreign funds.

penalties.details: Complaint filed with MHA and ED against four NGOs in Anantapur for operating proxy accounts and misusing FCRA.
